#### Equation for GHG Emission Reductions
The primary equation used to quantify net GHG emission reductions, particularly when improved cookstoves are introduced as an energy efficiency measure, is as follows:

\[
\text{Net GHG Reduction} = \text{Baseline Emissions} - \text{Project Emissions} - \text{Leakage Emissions}
\]

Where:
- **Baseline Emissions**: Emissions that would have occurred in the absence of the project.

- **Leakage Emissions**: Emissions resulting from the displacement of activities to areas outside the project boundary.

- Project Emissions: 20,000 tCO2e
- Leakage Emissions: 10,000 tCO2e
